title: The Relationship Between Language Features and PTSD Symptoms: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
data:
Z Yu, Z Gu, Y Shen, J Lu\xc2\xa0- Frontiers in Psychiatry, 2025
The aim of this study is to investigate the relationship between language features 
and symptoms of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) to determine if language 
features can serve as a reliable index for rapid screening and assessing PTSD. 
Methods: A comprehensive literature search was performed using Pubmed, Embase, 
Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials, Web of Science, and Ovid 
databases, augmented by backward reference tracking, to gather pertinent literature\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa6

title: Leveraging large language models for challenge solving in capture-the-flag
data:
Y Zou, Y Hong, J Xu, L Liu, W Fan\xc2\xa0- 2024 IEEE 23rd International Conference on\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa6, 2024
Capture-the-Flag (CTF) competitions are a prominent method in cybersecurity for 
practical attack and defense exercises. Despite the rapid advancements in Large 
Language Models (LLMs), their potential for solving CTF challenges remains 
underexplored. In this paper, we first propose a flexible CTF platform designed to 
reflect real-world penetration testing scenarios, bridging the gap between theoretical 
learning and practical cybersecurity challenges. Our platform is highly customizable\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa6
